text: Frances FitzGerald (born October 21, 1940)books.google.com is an American journalist and historian. She was born in New York City. She is known for her written work Fire in the Lake: The Vietnamese and the Americans in Vietnam (1972), which is about the Vietnam War. It won the Pulitzer Prize, Bancroft Prize, and National Book Award. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:Pulitzer Prize winners Category:American political writers Category:American historians Category:American war correspondents Category:Journalists from New York City
title: Frances FitzGerald
